Data Structures

class  EncodingParameters

Detailed Description

Base class for image-encoders, which are implemented as singleton. When starting the encoding, the data is protected by a semaphore automatically.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* ImageEncoder::Cb_ImageEncoded)(INT result, void *context, DataSink &dest)
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ImageEncoder::Error
 

Error code which can be retrieved by invoking ImageEncoder::GetLastError.

Enumerator:
NoError  No error has occured.
EncoderInitError  An error has occured during the initialization of the encoder.
FormatNotSupportedError  The format of the source data is not supported.
OutOfMemoryError  Not enough memory is available for doing the encoding.
EncodingError  An error occured during encoding the image.
DataSinkClosedError  The data sink, where the image should be encoded into, has been closed from outside, so that no encoding is possible anymore.
CouldNotAllocateThreadletError  The threadlet could not be allocated, which is required to encode the image asynchronously.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::BeginEncoding (  DataSink &  dest  )  [protected, virtual]
 

BeginEncoding has to be called when starting the encoding. Locks the encoder for exclusive usage.

Reimplemented in JpegEncoder, and PngEncoder.

virtual BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::Encode (  const Image &  src,
DataSink &  dest,
BOOLEAN  block = TRUE
)  [pure virtual]
 

Encodes an given image to the specified destination. The image size will be scaled to the size of the encoding parameters. It is recommended that the implementation creates it's decoding threadlet and invokes the protected method ImageEncoder::ExecuteThreadlet.

Parameters:
src Source image which should be converted.
dest Destination of the encoded image. The data sink must be already open, otherwise the method Encode will return FALSE. The closing of the data sink must be done manually by the the instance which opened the data sink first.
block If set to TRUE the encoding is done synchronously, which means that the thread is blocked until the converting has been finished. This is only recommended for encoding small images. When set to FALSE, the converting is done by the worker-thread and the message ImageEncodingProgressMsg including the progress-value is posted frequently, until the converting has been finished. Note that the passed image and the data sink may not be deleted during the asynchronous encoding.
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the encoding was successfully.

Implemented in JpegEncoder, and PngEncoder.

virtual BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::Encode (  BinData &  src,
const Image::MetaData &  src_params,
DataSink &  dest,
BOOLEAN  block = TRUE,
void *  context = 0,
Cb_ImageEncoded  callback = 0
)  [pure virtual]
 

Encodes image data from the given source with the given encoding parameters to the destination represented by a data sink. The size given in src_params will be used for encoding and the size given by the encoding parameters will be ignored. It is recommended that the implementation creates it's decoding threadlet and invokes the protected method ImageEncoder::ExecuteThreadlet.

Parameters:
src Source of the image data. Note that the BinData object is obtained now by the encoder and hence automatically released when the decoding has been finished. After passing the BinData object to the encoder it is not allowed to invoke the method BinData::ReleaseInstance.
src_params Parameters which describes the source image data.
dest Destination of the encoded image. The data sink must be already open, otherwise the method Encode will return FALSE. The closing of the data sink must be done manually by the the instance which opened the data sink first.
block If set to TRUE the encoding is done synchronously, which means that the thread is blocked until the converting has been finished. This is only recommended for encoding small images. When set to FALSE, the converting is done by the worker-thread and the message ImageEncodingProgressMsg including the progress-value is posted frequently, until the converting has been finished. Note that the passed bin data object, the meta data and the data sink may not be deleted during the asynchronous encoding.
context Pointer to any data which the application may pass through the callback. In most cases this is the callers application "this" pointer.
callback Application's callback, which is called when image has been encoded. Parameter block must be set to FALSE in order to use the callback! Callback will be sent even if image encoding was cancelled or broken.
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the encoding was successfully.

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::EncodeSynchronously (  const Image &  img,
DataSink &  dest
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Encodes an given image to the specified destination. The default implementation returns FALSE and should be reimplemented by derived image encoders. The image size will be scaled to the size of the encoding parameters. This method is used by the default implementation of EncodingThreadlet to encode the image synchronously in the context of the threadlet.

Parameters:
dest Destination of the encoded image. The data sink must be already open, otherwise the method Encode will return FALSE. The closing of the data sink must be done manually by the the instance which opened the data sink first.
block If set to TRUE the encoding is done synchronously, which means that the thread is blocked until the converting has been finished. This is only recommended for encoding small images. When set to FALSE, the converting is done by the worker-thread and the message ImageEncodingProgressMsg including the progress-value is posted frequently, until the converting has been finished. Note that the passed image and the data sink may not be deleted during the asynchronous encoding.
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the encoding was successfully.

Reimplemented in JpegEncoder, and PngEncoder.

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::EncodeSynchronously (  BinData &  src,
const Image::MetaData &  src_params,
DataSink &  dest
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Encodes image data from the given source with the given encoding parameters to the destination represented by a data sink. The default implementation returns FALSE and should be reimplemented by derived image encoders. The size given in src_params will be used for encoding and the size given by the encoding parameters will be ignored. This method is used by the default implementation of EncodingThreadlet to encode the image synchronously in the context of the threadlet.

Parameters:
src Source of the image data. Note that the BinData object is obtained now by the encoder and hence automatically released when the decoding has been finished. After passing the BinData object to the encoder it is not allowed to invoke the method BinData::ReleaseInstance.
src_params Parameters which describes the source image data.
dest Destination of the encoded image. The data sink must be already open, otherwise the method Encode will return FALSE. The closing of the data sink must be done manually by the the instance which opened the data sink first.
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the encoding was successfully.

Reimplemented in JpegEncoder, and PngEncoder.

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::EndEncoding (  DataSink &  dest  )  [protected, virtual]
 

EndEncoding has to be called when finished encoding and unlocks the encoder.

Reimplemented in JpegEncoder, and PngEncoder.

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::ExecuteThreadlet (  Threadlet *  threadlet,
BOOLEAN  block
)  [protected]
 

Executes the given threadlet threadlet in the corresponding blocking mode. It is recommended that the implementations of the method ImageEncoder::Encode create an instance of a threadlet and invoke this method for execution. If threadlet is 0 a corresponding error code is set automatically, which can be retrieved by ImageEncoder::GetLastError.

const EncodingParameters* ImageEncoder::GetEncodingParams (   )  const [inline]
 

GetEncodingParams returns the used encoding parameters. Has to be casted to the used specific decoder, e.g. JpegEncoder: (JpegEncoder::EncodingParameters*)enc->GetEncodingParams();

Returns:
returns the given EncodingParameters, and can be changed

Error ImageEncoder::GetLastError (   )  const [inline]
 

Retrieves the last error

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::IsEncoding (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the image is encoded currently. Invoking this method is only useful, if an asynchronous encoding is done.

BOOLEAN ImageEncoder::IsStopEncodingRequested (   )  const [inline, protected]
 

Returns TRUE, if the encoding should be stopped. Requesting this information is only necessary when derived classes implement asynchronous encoding by threadlets.

See also:
ImageEncoder::MarkEncodingFinished

void ImageEncoder::SetEncodingParams (  const EncodingParameters *  params  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the encoding parameters for encoding.

void ImageEncoder::SetLastError (  Error  error  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the error code which can be retrieved by ImageEncoder::GetLastError from outside.

void ImageEncoder::StopEncoding (  BOOLEAN  block = TRUE  ) 
 

Stops the encoding. Invoking this method is only useful, if an asynchronous encoding is done.

Parameters:
block  = TRUE
